newsitem.title: UK: Yorkshire Food to start tighter div policy.
newsitem.headline: Yorkshire Food to start tighter div policy.

text.p: Yorkshire Food said its dividend policy will become more conservative as the loss-making group wants to retain more funds for investments.
"The focus will be on capital conservation for investment purposes," Yorkshire Food said.
Yorkshire Food also announced that chief operating officer Paul Haley has been promoted to the vacant position of chief executive.
A spokeswoman said the move means that chairman Mike Firth will take more of a backseat role. "Apart from that nothing much changes," the spokeswoman said.

Yorkshire Food earlier reported a first-half pre-tax loss of 4.09 million stg, greater than an 85,000 stg loss in the same 1995 period due to the effects of its restructuring and disposal programme in Britain.
Yorkshire repeated that it expected a full-year loss due to the negative impact of its rationalisations which are now substantially completed.
Yorkshire Food expects its U.S. subsidiaries to be profitable in the second half of the year, and it forecast that the British subsidiaries would not produce any significant losses.
